loans.name: Monyrort

texts.en:
C. Monyrort is a farmer. He is living with his wife, three children and two younger brothers in a village near to Phnom Penh. He is growing rice and vegetables and owns 4 cows, which are very useful to plough his parcels of land. When the cows are too old to work, he sells them for their meat. He is rather experienced in raising cows and would like to turn this activity into a profitable business. His wife is running her own business, selling water spinach, she can make $5 per day.

C. Monyrort is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy an additional cow and to build a cow-house to shelter these precious animals. The cow will cost him between $500 and $700 while the materials (cement, wood and zinc mainly) for building the cow-house are worth $500. In addition to performing the works by himself, Monyrort will probably invest some of his own savings in the business too. The cow-house will be big enough for at least 10 animals and Monyrort might well buy one more with his next CREDIT loans.

loans.use: BUying a cow and building a cow-house

payments.comment: Chin Monyort was able to pay off his loan early. Thank you for partnering with CREDIT MFI to assist Chin Monyort.

loans.name: Chanthon

texts.en:
K. Chanthon has born ten children, six of them are still living with her. She is a widow and supports her family with a small business she is running with her four grown children. They sell dry food in front of the numerous factories in this area. The five of them can sell for 160,000 Riel ($40) per day, out of which 40,000 Riel ($10) profit.

K. Chanthon wants to start a new business. Her plan is to open a real shop in front of a factory. She could sell clothes, spices and even more…

She needs $500 to have the shop built and would like to purchase for $500 stock. She will probably also invest her own savings.

K. Chanthon is confident because she knows that two of her grown sons, who are employed in factories, would help her if anything wrong happened. If this business is successful, she is already considering another one, which would be building a house to rent it.

loans.use: Build a small shop in front of the factories

loans.name: Komtia

texts.en:
K. Kontia is living in Phnom Penh city, with her husband and three children. She is running a small grocery shop in front of her house and sells various products to the people in the neighborhood. Kontia has sweet and toys for children but also soap and noodles for their parents, and almost everything necessary for the household.

She started the business 3 months ago and invested $400 of her own money already. She is now requesting $600 to increase her stocks and offer more products. She confident, the business is good so far, but she needs additional running capital.

For the moment, she is she can sell for 150,000 Riel ($37.5) everyday, and make 20,000 Riel ($5) on the shop but she expects better as the number of clients is increasing. With the 20,000 Riel her husband earns as a moto-taxi, K. Kontia can support her family. She is very proud that her eldest son and daughter are going to school. She would like to be able to send the last one also very soon.

loans.use: purchasing stock

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is married with 4 children and her last born is in college. She is a retired civil servant and now her major source of income is from the sale of milk from two cows. Her last born is in her final year at Shine College doing Certified Public Accountants stage 3, she is privately sponsored and this requires a lot of money. Currently she sells 10 litres per day which gives her USD 4 a day. Damaris’ income is very low to pay for her child school fees and thus need to access a loan which will be paid in installments on a monthly basis. This would be easier for her because her business will not be affected and her cash flow will remain stable.

loans.use: She would like to pay School fees for her child who is in her final year doing CPA(K).

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 27 years old, married with one child who is attending nursery school. She has been a treasurer of a savings and credit group called Mary Gorret Kiangunyi for the last four years. She started her business in 1998 with only one piece of welding machine and one person. Currently, she has two welding machines and employs four people. She is planning to open up another branch in Nairobi where the demand for metal works is relatively high. Her average sales per month range from USD 300 toUSD500. She expects to increase her sales when she gets another machine from USD 500 to at least USD 700.

loans.use: She would like to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 48 years old and a teacher by profession. She is married with 6 children; three of them are in primary school, 1 in college and the other in secondary school.  She has a dairy cow and also grows maize, beans, Potatoes & Vegetables for sale as well as for home consumption. Her cow produces 8 litres per day, therefore she earns USD2.35. In addition to earnings from milk, she sells vegetables and she gets USD220 per month.

Maize being the main food for Kenyans, there is market for maize in whichever form it is. Also her milk has ready market because she supplies her fellow teachers.

loans.use: She intends to buy one more cow to increase milk production as well as sales.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 48 Years of age, married with 3 children. She is primary school teacher. The salary from teaching service was not enough to cater for her home expenses thus; she decided to start up a small retail shop in April 2006 this year to supplement her salary. The business is progressing and she is earning USD 73 per month. The business is situated in Githurai a busy market, this call for a well stocked shop in order to attract customers.

loans.use: The business is still under capitalized and therefore she wants to buy more of rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, soap, salt and bread.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years of age married with 4 children. Three of her children are in primary school and the other one in secondary school.She has a small bakery and supplies cakes to small retail shops in Kandara, Kenol, Thika and some parts of Nairobi. In addition to the cakes business, she also has a small shop where she sells ladies shoes. From her businesses she is able to get about $142 per month and this alone can not sustain her family. She is good at choosing ladies shoes because they don’t take a lot of time on the shelves and it makes her business grow. Considering the demand of her cakes, she is certain that if she increases quantity supplied per day then, she will start climbing the ladder to financial sustainability.

loans.use: Mary would like to increase the supply of cakes and to buy more shoes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 53 Years old, married with 2 children all in college. She is a teacher by profession and also a farmer. She has 2 dairy cows; they produce 10 litres of milk thus, she earns USD 3 per day. The business has been successful due to the ready market of fresh milk which she sells to the neighboring homes. She wants to start selling shoes to supplement income from milk and her teaching salary. With all income inflows, she believes the expenses of her family will be managed and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: She is to construct a shed for her cows and improve on cattle feeds so as to increase milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah would like to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to boost her business by buying latest ladies shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elizabeth would like to improve on the quality of her out put by planting hybrid crops which have high yield thus; she wants to buy hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice wants to buy first class used clothes to sell with the new clothes she makes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan started her business in 1986 by selling cosmetics in Nairobi Gikomba Market. She is 34years old, married with 4 children. She is a member of Wamama Development a church founded group which mobilizes Women to startup economic activities. She has a good clientele base that gives her courage to keep moving forward. Her customers include Salons, Small retail shops and to a small extent Individuals. Her monthly gross sales rage from USD735-880. Her target is to increase her sales to at least USD 1000 per month and this can only be done if she gets extra funding.

loans.use: Susan wants to buy cosmetics in large quantities to enjoy economies of scale and have a constant supply to her clients.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en: K. is married with 2 children and she is 26 years old. She started her business in 2002. She buys bales of used shoes from Mombasa and Nairobi then, sells to retailers. She sells 4 bales per day and makes profit of about USD 100-170. However, this will increase when all items are bought from Mombasa. She will be earning about USD200 per day.

loans.use: Kemunto wants to increase her capital base in order to have the capacity of buying in bulk from Mombasa where bales of shoes are relatively cheaper.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 34 years of age and has one child. She started her business in 2003 by selling food stuffs. As business grew, she started buying vitenge (African Attire) from Tanzania selling them in Nairobi. Over the years, the business has been growing and it has contributed greatly to providing School fees for her siblings as well as providing the basic necessities at home.

loans.use: She would like to buy a variety of African attire such that clients can have a variety to choose from.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is married with 1 child. After leaving college, she got a small job at Kware, Rongai and from the little savings she made, she bought her own sowing machine and started off her own work. She started her business in 1996. She gets tenders from schools for making uniforms ie dresses, shirts and shorts. The business has grown over the years and she bought other machines to coup up with the increasing demand.

loans.use: : She would like to buy more materials for uniforms and house hold items to easily supply her customers.

loans.name: Maritza Judith

texts.en:
My name is Mariza.  I have been making cinder blocks for 4 years, that are used in the construction of buildings, houses, walls.  I have a great clientele, especially some iron workers in my city.  The generated income from this activity help me fulfill family and business commitments.  I am experienced in this business and due to the high demand, I employ a few young people to help manufacture the cinder blocks.

[Note from Kiva:  The above is Kiva staff member's transalation of the below text -- using Google translator and working knowledge of Spanish based off of 4 years high school Spanish, a very long time ago!  Apologies for any errors or omissions.]

Mi nombre es Maritza tengo cuatro años de dedicarme a la elaboracion de Bloques, que se usan para construccion de edificios, casas, muros, ya tengo una buena clientela especialmente algunas ferreterias de mi ciudad, las ganacias que me genera esta actividad son bastantes buenas ya que me ayudan a cumplir con los compromisos familiares y del negocio. Este negocio es familiar y debido a la demanda que tengo de pedidos he contratado a otros jovenes quienes nos ayudan para la fabricacion de los bloques.

loans.use: Compra de cemento, arena, herramientas como pala, carreta de mano y otros

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.en:
I have had my grocery store for five years, it is visited by neighbors as well as people from other communities. I am interested in attending my clientel well, for which they always treat me with respect. The earnings help me to contribute with the expenses of food and education of my two children so that they finish elementary school.

Loan Use: Buying bread, eggs, flour, butter, drinks, churros, condiments and others 

Tengo cinco años de tener mi pulperia, la cual es visitada por vecinos y otras personas de otras comunidades, me interesa atender bien a mis clientes por lo que siempre les doy un trato personalizado. Las ganacias me ayudan a contribuir con los gastos de almientacion y educacion de mis dos hijos para que finalicen su primaria.

loans.use: Compra de pan, huevos, harina, manteca, refrescos, churros, condimentos y otros

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.en:
I have been working for one year in my hardware store, it is a family run business, in which my two children and other youths that I have contracted, attend to my clients. I have a loyal clientel, since, for the price, I make contracts with the houses being constructed and the builders in my city. This activity generates enough (income) to support my family.

Loan Use: Cement, sand, screws, nails, sockets, floodlights, lamps and other 

Tengo un año de tener mi ferreteria, este es un negocio familiar en el que me ayudan mis dos hijos y otros jovenes que he contratado para atender a mis clientes, tengo clientela fija, ya que por los precios hago contratos con las casas constructoras y albañiles en mi ciudad. Esta actividad me genera lo suficiente para apoyar a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de cemento, arena, tornillos, clavos, toma corrientes, focos, lamparas y otros.
